experience: You and Norm both know Dan Nienhauser, Joe Mildenhall, and 26 others

Every college, university, student and classroom is unique in its own way and must be treated with respect. This is the cornerstone of Synergis Educations’ philosophy of education. Our “product” is the value we create for our partners, and that value is defined on an individual basis.Much like the relationship between teacher and student, the relationship between SEI and our partner institutions is grounded in trust. This trust sets in motion SEI’s ability to examine closely held data and formulate highly targeted strategies for strengthening retention, student outcomes and overall graduation rates.Our role is to cultivate the technology, resources and efforts that will enable everyone involved in the learning process to exceed their expectations. We accomplish this by:1.	Aligning incentives between capital sources and accredited institutions.2.	Leveraging world-class talent and technology, including Synergis EdVantage Learning System™.3.	Mobilizing private investment capital to fund innovation and produce best-in-class student outcomes.4.	Maintaining an unrelenting commitment to a service-focused partnership.Our ultimate purpose is to synergize our services with the core values of the partner institution to help the student achieve his or her life goals.

OperationsI.	Information technology: working with the CIO, ensure the ongoing updates to infrastructure, including hardware, software, and curriculum applicationsII.	Academic services: working with the CAO, help to monitor the relationship between university and health care partners allowing for operational efficiency as it relates to educating future nursesIII.	Marketing and Enrollment: working with the CMO, work to build a pipeline of activity that leads to overall student lifecycle successIV.	Organizational reporting and monitoring: provide guidance and leadership through management of the Orbis Education metrics and measurement reporting processV.	Site management: oversee operational functions for all Orbis Education sites nationwide, ensuring smooth daily operations of locationsVI.	Board of directors – working with the CEO provide staff support and guidance to the Orbis Education board and act as staff liaison to relevant board committeesFinancial Management and OversightI.	Working with the Director of Finance, oversee all financial and business planning activitiesII.	Oversee reporting and monitoring of organizational performance metricsHuman ResourcesI.	Working with the director of human resources, manage and oversee the human resource function for Orbis Education.II.	Ensuring that the human resource function is properly resourced and represented within the senior management team

•	Lead the organization towards enrollment growth and site expansion•	Oversee all Human Resource activities for the organization to include the incentive compensation rules governing enrollment compensation•	Identify and forge relationships with hospital organizations across the United States that demonstrate a need for nurses and are willing to work in a collaborative effort to facilitate clinicals•	Establish standard operational practices that are repeatable to grow the organization from 4 existing locations to 25 locations in 36 months•	Act as a liaison between the company’s board of directors, the hospitals and the university partners to ensure a synergistic relationship•	Responsible for creating a network of industry experts to assist in review and subsequent follow up needed to address any and all changes that arise from the elimination of the Safe Harbors enacted in 2002

Lead 9 directors and 134 regional staff members to generate significant revenue and profits for adult programs at small liberal arts colleges and universities throughout northern United States. Manage contracts with eight colleges and universities in region covering Michigan, Wisconsin, Connecticut, Delaware, Minnesota, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Illinois, and Ohio to ensure all revenue, profit, and expense goals are met. Collaborate with National Director of Enrollment to establish and launch marketing strategies designed to drive lead and new business generation. Promote succession planning and career development throughout organization. Monitor business trends, market happenings, and changes in regulatory and compliance issues including Title IV, State, Regional, and Federal Department of Education, Higher Learning, and Accreditation.

recommendations: Rob Knecht
Egg Farmer at Konos, Inc.
August 12, 2008, Norm was senior to Rob but didn’t manage directly

I recommend Norm Allgood without hesitation.Norm understands how to strategically direct multiple groups at the same time.  He was managing multiple enrollment efforts; each location meeting, and several locations exceeding thier budget.  Different environments required different management styles, some more hands on and other more hands off, and Norm understands the delicate balance between the two.Norm also understands the value of metrics when looking at strategic goals.  During my tenure under him, he placed the appropriate amount of emphasis on each level of the organization to maximize production of the team.  This resulted in surpassing the goals and metrics allocated to each division.Finally, Norm has the ability to interact with all levels of an organization.  Norm was not my direct manager, however, he was able to relate to me and my teammates.  His ability to interact across all levels of an organization makes him a very valuable team member and manager.

Laurie Wittbrodt
Director of Graduate Enrollment at Aquinas College - Grand Rapids
September 7, 2016, Norm was senior to Laurie but didn’t manage directly

By way of introduction my name is Norm Allgood and I am the Co-Founder and CEO of Synergis Education.  Synergis Education partners with Colleges and Universities to assist them in addressing the needs of 21st Century learners.The sole purpose of this note is to provide my sincerest recommendation to Laurie Wittbrodt.  Mrs. Wittbrodt worked at one of our partner institutions; Cornerstone University as the Associate Vice President of Client Relations (AVP).  Additionally, as our “Top Operator” she led the Company’s Enrollment Training Committee responsible for establishing a uniformed training program for all enrollment personnel. As the AVP, Laurie led a team of business development, enrollment and accounting personnel; focused on assisting Cornerstone University launch and operate degree programs, in face-to-face, online and or blended program formats. In her position, she carefully aligned an annual marketing strategy in excess of $1M and an overall operating budget in excess of $2M to attract and retain high-quality students to a diversified degree program offering.  Where other leaders had failed, Laurie’s ability to communicate, plan and balance all parties’ interests, paved the way for her operations to meet and exceed Revenue and EBITDA targets.In addition to her operational duties, Mrs. Wittbrodt maintained a solid relationship with our Partner Institution; Cornerstone University, thus allowing for a seamless experience for the student as they progressed through their degree program. Laurie has proven herself as a trusted and valuable asset to Synergis Education and to the overall world of education.  Her departure from Synergis Education is a great loss but an invaluable gain for the organization fortunate to hire her.
Laurie Wittbrodt

Client Engagement Manager at Eidex
August 30, 2016, Norm was senior to Aaron but didn’t manage directly

By way of introduction my name is Norm Allgood and I am the Co-Founder and CEO of Synergis Education.  I have dedicated nearly two decades of my career to expanding access to quality, affordable programs to underserved student populations. As CEO of Synergis Education, I focus on addressing the needs of 21st Century learners, while establishing and growing a mission-driven company that embraces forward-thinking to help move the education space forward.The sole purpose of this note is to provide my sincerest recommendation to Aaron Braunshneider.  Mr. Braunshneider worked at one of our partner institutions; Cornerstone University as a Director of Enrollment.  Additionally, he served on the Enrollment Training Committee and achieved the status of becoming a Synergis Champion. As a Director of Enrollment, Aaron led a team of enrollment personnel focused on assisting Cornerstone University launch market-demand degree programs, in face-to-face, online and or blended program formats. In so doing, he helped these institutions recruit high-quality students to a diversified degree program offering.  Additionally, during Mr. Braunshneider’ s tenure at Synergis, he assisted in training enrollment staff at other locations, as well as developing a long-term strategy to deliver training digitally to the entire organization’s enrollment operation. Aaron has proven himself as a trusted and valuable asset to Synergis Education and to the overall world of education.  His departure from Synergis Education is a great loss but an invaluable gain for the agency fortunate to hire him.
Aaron Braunschneider

summary: A hard-charging, enthusiastic senior leader with 22 years of building business and educational institutions through program development, saturating markets, establishing brand dominance, and streamlining operations. Nation-wide expertise at partnering with colleges and universities to develop and offer 56-faculty-developed online and blended degree programs at the undergraduate and graduate levels. Boards, presidents, provosts, deans and faculty colleagues have come to trust the creative, innovative and problem solving approach that has a proven track record of overcoming obstacles, meeting challenges head-on, and improving institutional performance. Peers and subordinates have come to expect that the empowering, optimistic leader is skilled in developing and mentoring staff, advocating for employees, and establishing competitive, yet synergistic environments that put in place a foundation for success.
name: Norm Allgood
title: CEO at Synergis Education
